metadata.title: CVE-2021-46966 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ACPI:custom_method: fix potential use-after-free issue In cm_write(), buf isalways freed when reaching the end of the function. If the requested countis less than table.length, the allocated buffer will be freed butsubsequent calls to cm_write() will still try to access it. Remove theunconditional kfree(buf) at the end of the function and set the buf to NULLin the -EINVAL error path to match the rest of function.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
